author: Trish Deseine
method: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C Fan/Gas 4. Grease and flour a 25cm/10 in round cake tin. Break the chocolate into small pieces and put them in a heatproof bowl, then set the bowl over a saucepan of barely simmering water (donâ€™t let the bottom of the bowl touch the water). Add the butter and sugar and let them melt with the chocolate. Stir well. Remove from the heat then break the eggs into the mixture one at a time, stirring well after each addition. Finally mix in the flour. Pour the mixture into the prepared tin and bake for 20 minutes. The cake should still be very moist in the centre. Remove from the oven and leave to cool completely before turning out.
ingredients: 200g/7oz dark chocolate (60% cocoa solids),  200g/7oz  butter, softened,  200g/7oz caster sugar,  5 free-range eggs,  1 heaped tbsp plain flour
